title: Sead Hadžibulić
text:
Sead Hadžibulić (; born 30 January 1983) is a <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>n <a href="Association%20football">football</a> forward.
Club career.
After beginning his career by playing in his home town clubs FK Jošanica and <a href="FK%20Novi%20Pazar">FK Novi Pazar</a> with short loan spell with <a href="FK%20Zvi%C5%BEd">FK Zvižd</a>. In summer 2007 he moved to Romania where he played the 2007–08 season with <a href="Liga%20I">Liga I</a> side <a href="ACF%20Gloria%20Bistri%C8%9Ba">Gloria Bistrița</a>. Next summer he was back in Serbia ready to make a debut in the <a href="Serbian%20SuperLiga">Serbian SuperLiga</a> with the newly promoted side <a href="FK%20Javor%20Ivanjica">FK Javor Ivanjica</a>. However fierce competition in the squad made him want to search for a place where he could get more chances, choosing to move abroad again, this time to <a href="Albanian%20Superliga">Albanian Superliga</a> side <a href="FK%20Apolonia%20Fier">FK Apolonia Fier</a> where he played until the winter break of the 2009–10 season. Another Albanian top flight side brought him that winter, <a href="KF%20Vllaznia%20Shkod%C3%ABr">KF Vllaznia Shkodër</a> having reached to become runners-up of the <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20Albanian%20Cup">2009–10 Albanian Cup</a> that season. Curiously, that summer he will move precisely to the team that had won them at that Cup final, <a href="KF%20Besa%20Kavaj%C3%AB">KF Besa Kavajë</a> who had just won the domestic <a href="Albanian%20Supercup">Supercup</a> title as well. However, the next season was not as successful as the previous one for Besa, and Hadžibulić left the team at the following winter break.
After having played for 2 years in Albanian top flight clubs, Hadžibulić returned to Serbia during the winter break of the 2010–11 season signing with his former club <a href="FK%20Javor%20Ivanjica">FK Javor Ivanjica</a>. This time he became a regular in the squad and, after only 6 months, his good performances earned him a move to a more ambitious SuperLiga side <a href="FK%20Hajduk%20Kula">FK Hajduk Kula</a>.
Tampines Rovers.
In June 2012, Hadžibulić joined the <a href="Tampines%20Rovers%20FC">Tampines Rovers</a> in Singapore. Over the course of one season, he scored 11 goals in 24 league games.
Jagodina.
On June 23, 2013, Hadžibulić signed for <a href="FK%20Jagodina">FK Jagodina</a>. After matches in <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20UEFA%20Europa%20League%20qualifying%20phase%20and%20play-off%20round">Europa League Qualifiers</a>, he left to <a href="FK%20Radni%C4%8Dki%20Ni%C5%A1">Radnički Niš</a>.
